sparse.eigenvolvers.java
Class Lobpcg

java.lang.Object
  sparse.eigenvolvers.java.SparseEigensolver
      sparse.eigenvolvers.java.Lobpcg

public class Lobpcg
extends SparseEigensolver

SEIG Java Lobpcg class.

SEIG uses the MTJ Java library (matrix-toolkits-java) and Netlib Java (netlib-java) for numerical linear algebra and matrix computations.

Lobpcg (Locally Optimal Block Preconditioned Conjugate Gradient Method) computes a set of the smallest eigenvalues lambda and corresponding eigenvectors X of the generalized eigenproblem A*x=lambda B*x, where Hermitian operators A and B are given, as well as a preconditioner, T. The operators B and T must, in addition, be positive definite. To compute the largest eigenpairs of A, simply apply the code to A multiplied by -1. The code does not involve any matrix factorizations of A and B. The matrices A, B and T may be provided as dense or compressed row matrices or as an operator function provided in a completely flexible manner by the user.

If a dense matrix Y is provided then the search is done in the orthogonal (B-orthogonal if B is given) complement of the column-space of Y.

The arguments residualTolerance and maxIterations control the residual tolerance and maximum number of steps, and verbosityLevel = 0, 1, or >1 controls the amount of printed information. The lambda (eigenvalue) history of all iterative lambdas, and the residual norms history of residuals can be obtained using the SparseEigensolver.getLambdaHistory() and SparseEigensolver.getResidualNormsHistory() methods after runLobpcg(Object...) is run.

This code does not compute all eigenvalues. It is designed to compute no more than ~20%, and attempting to compute more that 20% of the eigenpairs may cause the code to crash.

For background see [1], [2] and [3] below. The interface and structure of the code functionality is very similar to lobpcg.m, the Matlab version [2].

Example of use:
See runLobpcg(Object...) for details concerning parameters. 

Example with all possible arguments:
runLobpcg(X,A,B,T,Y,residualTolerance,maxIterations,verbosityLevel)

Example of just two arguments (solves A*x=lambda*x):
lobpcg.runLobpcg(X,A);

Example of X, A, tol, maxit, verb (solves A*x=lambda*x):
lobpcg.runLobpcg(X,A,1e-5,50,1);

Example of X, A, B, tol, maxit, verb (solves A*x=lambda*B*x):
lobpcg.runLobpcg(X,A,B,1e-5,50,1);

Example of no B or T, but there is constraint matrix Y (solves A*x=lambda*x):
lobpcg.runLobpcg(X,A,"","",Y,1e-5,50,1);

Example of no B but there is preconditioner T (solves A*x=lambda*x):
lobpcg.runLobpcg(X,A,"",T);
References:
[1] A. V. Knyazev, I. Lashuk, M. E. Argentati, and E. Ovchinnikov, Block Locally Optimal Preconditioned Eigenvalue Xolvers (BLOPEX) in hypre and PETSc, SIAM Journal on Scientific Computing (SISC), Vol. 29 (2007), No. 5, pp. 2224-2239.
[2] Lobpcg solves Hermitian partial generalized eigenproblems using preconditioning - Lobpcg (MATLAB)
[3] C-version of Lobpcg - Blopex

Author:
Rico Argentati

Constructor Detail

Lobpcg

public Lobpcg(int... args)
Method Detail

runLobpcg

public int runLobpcg(java.lang.Object... args)
Method for running Lobpcg with input arguments.
Example with all possible arguments:
runLobpcg(X,A,B,T,Y,residualTolerance,maxIterations,verbosityLevel)

Parameters:
X - initial approximation to eigenvectors, dense matrix (n-by-blockSize). X must be full rank.
A - the operator of the problem, can be given as a dense matrix, compressed row matrix or as an operator

Optional input:

B - the second operator, can be given as a dense matrix, compressed row matrix or as an operator
T - the preconditioner, can be given as a dense matrix, compressed row matrix or as an operator. T should be a approximation to the inverse of A to solve A*x=lambda*x
Y - constraints input, is a dense matrix. The iterations will be performed in the orthogonal (B-orthogonal if B is given) complement of the column-space of Y. Y must be full rank.
residualTolerance - (double), default is n*sqrt(eps)
maxIterations - (int), default is min(n,20)
verbosityLevel - (int), default is 1 (0 - no output, 1 standard output, >1 verbose output)

Note: if there is a T, but no B use "" as place holder for B. If there is a Y, but no B or T use place holder(s) "".

Returns:
convergence status (1 if converged, -1 if did not converge)

runLobpcg

public int runLobpcg()
Method for running lobpcg using set methods. Use subset of desired SparseEigensolver set methods to set up parameters. Then run method runLobpcg().
SparseEigensolver.setBlockVectorX(DenseMatrix blockVectorX)
SparseEigensolver.setA(DenseMatrix A)
SparseEigensolver.setA(CompRowMatrix A)
SparseEigensolver.setA(Operator A)
SparseEigensolver.setB(DenseMatrix B)
SparseEigensolver.setB(CompRowMatrix B)
SparseEigensolver.setB(Operator B)
SparseEigensolver.setT(DenseMatrix T)
SparseEigensolver.setT(CompRowMatrix T)
SparseEigensolver.setT(Operator T)
SparseEigensolver.setBlockVectorY(DenseMatrix blockVectorY)
SparseEigensolver.setMaxIterations(int maxIterations)
SparseEigensolver.setResidualTolerance(double residualTolerance)
SparseEigensolver.setVerbosityLevel(int verbosityLevel)

Returns:
convergence status (1 if converged, -1 if did not converge)
